description: Sends user input to Amazon Lex V2. Client applications use this API to send requests to Amazon Lex V2 at runtime. Amazon Lex V2 then interprets the user input using the machine learning model that it build for the bot. In response, Amazon Lex V2 returns the next message to convey to the user and an optional response card to display. If the optional post-fulfillment response is specified, the messages are returned as follows. For more information, see PostFulfillmentStatusSpecification. For more information, see Completion message.

parameters.name: botId
parameters.description: The identifier of the bot that processes the request.

parameters.name: botAliasId
parameters.description: The alias identifier in use for the bot that processes the request.

parameters.name: localeId
parameters.description: The locale where the session is in use.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: The identifier of the user session that is having the conversation.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text that the user entered. Amazon Lex V2 interprets this text.

parameters.name: sessionState
parameters.description: The current state of the dialog between the user and the bot. dialogAction (dict) --- The next step that Amazon Lex V2 should take in the conversation with a user. The next action that the bot should take in its interaction with the user. The following values are possible: Close --- Indicates that there will not be a response from the user. For example, the statement 'Your order has been placed' does not require a response. ConfirmIntent --- The next action is asking the user if the intent is complete and ready to be fulfilled. This is a yes/no question such as 'Place the order?' Delegate --- The next action is determined by Amazon Lex V2. ElicitIntent --- The next action is to elicit an intent from the user. ElicitSlot --- The next action is to elicit a slot value from the user. slotToElicit (string) --- The name of the slot that should be elicited from the user. slotElicitationStyle (string) --- Configures the slot to use spell-by-letter or spell-by-word style. When you use a style on a slot, users can spell out their input to make it clear to your bot. Spell by letter - 'b' 'o' 'b' Spell by word - 'b as in boy' 'o as in oscar' 'b as in boy' For more information, see Using spelling to enter slot values. subSlotToElicit (dict) --- The name of the constituent sub slot of the composite slot specified in slotToElicit that should be elicited from the user. The name of the slot that should be elicited from the user. subSlotToElicit (dict) --- The field is not supported. intent (dict) --- The active intent that Amazon Lex V2 is processing. The name of the intent. slots (dict) --- A map of all of the slots for the intent. The name of the slot maps to the value of the slot. If a slot has not been filled, the value is null. (string) --- (dict) --- A value that Amazon Lex V2 uses to fulfill an intent. value (dict) --- The current value of the slot. originalValue (string) --- The part of the user's response to the slot elicitation that Amazon Lex V2 determines is relevant to the slot value. The value that Amazon Lex V2 determines for the slot, given the user input. The actual value depends on the setting of the value selection strategy for the bot. You can choose to use the value entered by the user, or you can have Amazon Lex V2 choose the first value in the resolvedValues list. resolvedValues (list) --- A list of values that Amazon Lex V2 determines are possible resolutions for the user input. The first value matches the interpretedValue. (string) --- shape (string) --- When the shape value is List, it indicates that the values field contains a list of slot values. When the value is Scalar, it indicates that the value field contains a single value. values (list) --- A list of one or more values that the user provided for the slot. For example, if a for a slot that elicits pizza toppings, the values might be 'pepperoni' and 'pineapple.' (dict) --- A value that Amazon Lex V2 uses to fulfill an intent. subSlots (dict) --- The constituent sub slots of a composite slot. state (string) --- Indicates the fulfillment state for the intent. The meanings of each value are as follows: Failed --- The bot failed to fulfill the intent. Fulfilled --- The bot has completed fulfillment of the intent. FulfillmentInProgress --- The bot is in the middle of fulfilling the intent. InProgress --- The bot is in the middle of eliciting the slot values that are necessary to fulfill the intent. ReadyForFulfillment --- The bot has elicited all the slot values for the intent and is ready to fulfill the intent. Waiting --- The bot is waiting for a response from the user (limited to streaming conversations). confirmationState (string) --- Indicates whether the intent has been Confirmed, Denied, or None if the confirmation stage has not yet been reached. activeContexts (list) --- One or more contexts that indicate to Amazon Lex V2 the context of a request. When a context is active, Amazon Lex V2 considers intents with the matching context as a trigger as the next intent in a session. (dict) --- Contains information about the contexts that a user is using in a session. You can configure Amazon Lex V2 to set a context when an intent is fulfilled, or you can set a context using the , , or operations. Use a context to indicate to Amazon Lex V2 intents that should be used as follow-up intents. For example, if the active context is order-fulfilled, only intents that have order-fulfilled configured as a trigger are considered for follow up. The name of the context. Indicates the number of turns or seconds that the context is active. Once the time to live expires, the context is no longer returned in a response. The number of seconds that the context is active. You can specify between 5 and 86400 seconds (24 hours). The number of turns that the context is active. You can specify up to 20 turns. Each request and response from the bot is a turn. A list of contexts active for the request. A context can be activated when a previous intent is fulfilled, or by including the context in the request. If you don't specify a list of contexts, Amazon Lex V2 will use the current list of contexts for the session. If you specify an empty list, all contexts for the session are cleared. (string) --- (string) --- sessionAttributes (dict) --- Map of key/value pairs representing session-specific context information. It contains application information passed between Amazon Lex V2 and a client application. (string) --- (string) --- originatingRequestId (string) --- A unique identifier for a specific request. runtimeHints (dict) --- Hints for phrases that a customer is likely to use for a slot. Amazon Lex V2 uses the hints to help determine the correct value of a slot. slotHints (dict) --- A list of the slots in the intent that should have runtime hints added, and the phrases that should be added for each slot. The first level of the slotHints map is the name of the intent. The second level is the name of the slot within the intent. For more information, see Using hints to improve accuracy. The intent name and slot name must exist. (string) --- (dict) --- (string) --- (dict) --- Provides an array of phrases that should be given preference when resolving values for a slot. runtimeHintValues (list) --- One or more strings that Amazon Lex V2 should look for in the input to the bot. Each phrase is given preference when deciding on slot values. (dict) --- Provides the phrase that Amazon Lex V2 should look for in the user's input to the bot. The phrase that Amazon Lex V2 should look for in the user's input to the bot. subSlotHints (dict) --- A map of constituent sub slot names inside a composite slot in the intent and the phrases that should be added for each sub slot. Inside each composite slot hints, this structure provides a mechanism to add granular sub slot phrases. Only sub slot hints are supported for composite slots. The intent name, composite slot name and the constituent sub slot names must exist.

nested_params.name: dialogAction
nested_params.description: The next step that Amazon Lex V2 should take in the conversation with a user.

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The next action that the bot should take in its interaction with the user. The following values are possible:

nested_params.name: slotToElicit
nested_params.description: The name of the slot that should be elicited from the user.

nested_params.name: slotElicitationStyle
nested_params.description: Configures the slot to use spell-by-letter or spell-by-word style. When you use a style on a slot, users can spell out their input to make it clear to your bot.

nested_params.name: subSlotToElicit
nested_params.description: The name of the constituent sub slot of the composite slot specified in slotToElicit that should be elicited from the user.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the slot that should be elicited from the user.

nested_params.name: subSlotToElicit
nested_params.description: The field is not supported.

nested_params.name: intent
nested_params.description: The active intent that Amazon Lex V2 is processing.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the intent.

nested_params.name: slots
nested_params.description: A map of all of the slots for the intent. The name of the slot maps to the value of the slot. If a slot has not been filled, the value is null.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The current value of the slot.

nested_params.name: originalValue
nested_params.description: The part of the user's response to the slot elicitation that Amazon Lex V2 determines is relevant to the slot value.

nested_params.name: interpretedValue
nested_params.description: The value that Amazon Lex V2 determines for the slot, given the user input. The actual value depends on the setting of the value selection strategy for the bot. You can choose to use the value entered by the user, or you can have Amazon Lex V2 choose the first value in the resolvedValues list.

nested_params.name: resolvedValues
nested_params.description: A list of values that Amazon Lex V2 determines are possible resolutions for the user input. The first value matches the interpretedValue.

nested_params.name: shape
nested_params.description: When the shape value is List, it indicates that the values field contains a list of slot values. When the value is Scalar, it indicates that the value field contains a single value.

nested_params.name: values
nested_params.description: A list of one or more values that the user provided for the slot. For example, if a for a slot that elicits pizza toppings, the values might be 'pepperoni' and 'pineapple.'

nested_params.name: subSlots
nested_params.description: The constituent sub slots of a composite slot.

nested_params.name: state
nested_params.description: Indicates the fulfillment state for the intent. The meanings of each value are as follows:

nested_params.name: confirmationState
nested_params.description: Indicates whether the intent has been Confirmed, Denied, or None if the confirmation stage has not yet been reached.

nested_params.name: activeContexts
nested_params.description: One or more contexts that indicate to Amazon Lex V2 the context of a request. When a context is active, Amazon Lex V2 considers intents with the matching context as a trigger as the next intent in a session.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the context.

nested_params.name: timeToLive
nested_params.description: Indicates the number of turns or seconds that the context is active. Once the time to live expires, the context is no longer returned in a response.

nested_params.name: timeToLiveInSeconds
nested_params.description: The number of seconds that the context is active. You can specify between 5 and 86400 seconds (24 hours).

nested_params.name: turnsToLive
nested_params.description: The number of turns that the context is active. You can specify up to 20 turns. Each request and response from the bot is a turn.

nested_params.name: contextAttributes
nested_params.description: A list of contexts active for the request. A context can be activated when a previous intent is fulfilled, or by including the context in the request. If you don't specify a list of contexts, Amazon Lex V2 will use the current list of contexts for the session. If you specify an empty list, all contexts for the session are cleared.

nested_params.name: sessionAttributes
nested_params.description: Map of key/value pairs representing session-specific context information. It contains application information passed between Amazon Lex V2 and a client application.

nested_params.name: originatingRequestId
nested_params.description: A unique identifier for a specific request.

nested_params.name: runtimeHints
nested_params.description: Hints for phrases that a customer is likely to use for a slot. Amazon Lex V2 uses the hints to help determine the correct value of a slot.

nested_params.name: slotHints
nested_params.description: A list of the slots in the intent that should have runtime hints added, and the phrases that should be added for each slot. The first level of the slotHints map is the name of the intent. The second level is the name of the slot within the intent. For more information, see Using hints to improve accuracy. The intent name and slot name must exist.

nested_params.name: runtimeHintValues
nested_params.description: One or more strings that Amazon Lex V2 should look for in the input to the bot. Each phrase is given preference when deciding on slot values.

nested_params.name: phrase
nested_params.description: The phrase that Amazon Lex V2 should look for in the user's input to the bot.

nested_params.name: subSlotHints
nested_params.description: A map of constituent sub slot names inside a composite slot in the intent and the phrases that should be added for each sub slot. Inside each composite slot hints, this structure provides a mechanism to add granular sub slot phrases. Only sub slot hints are supported for composite slots. The intent name, composite slot name and the constituent sub slot names must exist.

parameters.name: requestAttributes
parameters.description: Request-specific information passed between the client application and Amazon Lex V2 The namespace x-amz-lex: is reserved for special attributes. Don't create any request attributes with the prefix x-amz-lex:. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.name: messages
nested_items.description: A list of messages last sent to the user. The messages are ordered based on the order that you returned the messages from your Lambda function or the order that the messages are defined in the bot.

nested_items.name: content
nested_items.description: The text of the message.

nested_items.name: contentType
nested_items.description: Indicates the type of response.

nested_items.name: imageResponseCard
nested_items.description: A card that is shown to the user by a messaging platform. You define the contents of the card, the card is displayed by the platform.

nested_items.name: title
nested_items.description: The title to display on the response card. The format of the title is determined by the platform displaying the response card.

nested_items.name: subtitle
nested_items.description: The subtitle to display on the response card. The format of the subtitle is determined by the platform displaying the response card.

nested_items.name: imageUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of an image to display on the response card. The image URL must be publicly available so that the platform displaying the response card has access to the image.

nested_items.name: buttons
nested_items.description: A list of buttons that should be displayed on the response card. The arrangement of the buttons is determined by the platform that displays the button.

nested_items.name: text
nested_items.description: The text that is displayed on the button.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value returned to Amazon Lex V2 when a user chooses the button.

nested_items.name: sessionState
nested_items.description: Represents the current state of the dialog between the user and the bot.

nested_items.name: dialogAction
nested_items.description: The next step that Amazon Lex V2 should take in the conversation with a user.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The next action that the bot should take in its interaction with the user. The following values are possible:
Close --- Indicates that there will not be a response from the user. For example, the statement 'Your order has been placed' does not require a response.
ConfirmIntent --- The next action is asking the user if the intent is complete and ready to be fulfilled. This is a yes/no question such as 'Place the order?'
Delegate --- The next action is determined by Amazon Lex V2.
ElicitIntent --- The next action is to elicit an intent from the user.
ElicitSlot --- The next action is to elicit a slot value from the user.

nested_items.name: slotToElicit
nested_items.description: The name of the slot that should be elicited from the user.

nested_items.name: slotElicitationStyle
nested_items.description: Configures the slot to use spell-by-letter or spell-by-word style. When you use a style on a slot, users can spell out their input to make it clear to your bot.
Spell by letter - 'b' 'o' 'b'
Spell by word - 'b as in boy' 'o as in oscar' 'b as in boy'

nested_items.name: subSlotToElicit
nested_items.description: The name of the constituent sub slot of the composite slot specified in slotToElicit that should be elicited from the user.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the slot that should be elicited from the user.

nested_items.name: subSlotToElicit
nested_items.description: The field is not supported.

nested_items.description: The name of the intent.

nested_items.name: originalValue
nested_items.description: The part of the user's response to the slot elicitation that Amazon Lex V2 determines is relevant to the slot value.

nested_items.name: interpretedValue
nested_items.description: The value that Amazon Lex V2 determines for the slot, given the user input. The actual value depends on the setting of the value selection strategy for the bot. You can choose to use the value entered by the user, or you can have Amazon Lex V2 choose the first value in the resolvedValues list.

nested_items.name: resolvedValues
nested_items.description: A list of values that Amazon Lex V2 determines are possible resolutions for the user input. The first value matches the interpretedValue.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: shape
nested_items.description: When the shape value is List, it indicates that the values field contains a list of slot values. When the value is Scalar, it indicates that the value field contains a single value.

nested_items.name: values
nested_items.description: A list of one or more values that the user provided for the slot. For example, if a for a slot that elicits pizza toppings, the values might be 'pepperoni' and 'pineapple.'

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: Indicates the fulfillment state for the intent. The meanings of each value are as follows:
Failed --- The bot failed to fulfill the intent.
Fulfilled --- The bot has completed fulfillment of the intent.
FulfillmentInProgress --- The bot is in the middle of fulfilling the intent.
InProgress --- The bot is in the middle of eliciting the slot values that are necessary to fulfill the intent.
ReadyForFulfillment --- The bot has elicited all the slot values for the intent and is ready to fulfill the intent.
Waiting --- The bot is waiting for a response from the user (limited to streaming conversations).

nested_items.name: confirmationState
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the intent has been Confirmed, Denied, or None if the confirmation stage has not yet been reached.

nested_items.name: activeContexts
nested_items.description: One or more contexts that indicate to Amazon Lex V2 the context of a request. When a context is active, Amazon Lex V2 considers intents with the matching context as a trigger as the next intent in a session.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the context.

nested_items.name: timeToLive
nested_items.description: Indicates the number of turns or seconds that the context is active. Once the time to live expires, the context is no longer returned in a response.

nested_items.name: timeToLiveInSeconds
nested_items.description: The number of seconds that the context is active. You can specify between 5 and 86400 seconds (24 hours).

nested_items.name: turnsToLive
nested_items.description: The number of turns that the context is active. You can specify up to 20 turns. Each request and response from the bot is a turn.

nested_items.name: contextAttributes
nested_items.description: A list of contexts active for the request. A context can be activated when a previous intent is fulfilled, or by including the context in the request.

nested_items.name: runtimeHints
nested_items.description: Hints for phrases that a customer is likely to use for a slot. Amazon Lex V2 uses the hints to help determine the correct value of a slot.

nested_items.name: slotHints
nested_items.description: A list of the slots in the intent that should have runtime hints added, and the phrases that should be added for each slot.

nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: runtimeHintValues
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: runtimeHintValues
nested_items.description: One or more strings that Amazon Lex V2 should look for in the input to the bot. Each phrase is given preference when deciding on slot values.

nested_items.name: phrase
nested_items.description: The phrase that Amazon Lex V2 should look for in the user's input to the bot.

nested_items.name: subSlotHints
nested_items.description: A map of constituent sub slot names inside a composite slot in the intent and the phrases that should be added for each sub slot. Inside each composite slot hints, this structure provides a mechanism to add granular sub slot phrases. Only sub slot hints are supported for composite slots. The intent name, composite slot name and the constituent sub slot names must exist.

nested_items.name: interpretations
nested_items.description: A list of intents that Amazon Lex V2 determined might satisfy the user's utterance.

nested_items.name: nluConfidence
nested_items.description: Determines the threshold where Amazon Lex V2 will insert the AMAZON.FallbackIntent, AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent, or both when returning alternative intents in a response. AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent are only inserted if they are configured for the bot.

nested_items.name: score
nested_items.description: A score that indicates how confident Amazon Lex V2 is that an intent satisfies the user's intent. Ranges between 0.00 and 1.00. Higher scores indicate higher confidence.

nested_items.name: sentimentResponse
nested_items.description: The sentiment expressed in an utterance.

nested_items.name: sentiment
nested_items.description: The overall sentiment expressed in the user's response. This is the sentiment most likely expressed by the user based on the analysis by Amazon Comprehend.

nested_items.name: sentimentScore
nested_items.description: The individual sentiment responses for the utterance.

nested_items.name: positive
nested_items.description: The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of its detection of the POSITIVE sentiment.

nested_items.name: negative
nested_items.description: The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of its detection of the NEGATIVE sentiment.

nested_items.name: neutral
nested_items.description: The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of its detection of the NEUTRAL sentiment.

nested_items.name: mixed
nested_items.description: The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of its detection of the MIXED sentiment.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the intent.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: originalValue
nested_items.description: The part of the user's response to the slot elicitation that Amazon Lex V2 determines is relevant to the slot value.

nested_items.name: interpretedValue
nested_items.description: The value that Amazon Lex V2 determines for the slot, given the user input. The actual value depends on the setting of the value selection strategy for the bot. You can choose to use the value entered by the user, or you can have Amazon Lex V2 choose the first value in the resolvedValues list.

nested_items.name: resolvedValues
nested_items.description: A list of values that Amazon Lex V2 determines are possible resolutions for the user input. The first value matches the interpretedValue.

Failed --- The bot failed to fulfill the intent.
Fulfilled --- The bot has completed fulfillment of the intent.
FulfillmentInProgress --- The bot is in the middle of fulfilling the intent.
InProgress --- The bot is in the middle of eliciting the slot values that are necessary to fulfill the intent.
ReadyForFulfillment --- The bot has elicited all the slot values for the intent and is ready to fulfill the intent.

nested_items.description: Specifies the service that interpreted the input.

nested_items.description: The attributes sent in the request.

nested_items.description: The bot member that recognized the text.
